_exec_summary.SummaryText:
For Further information contact Robert Speicher-General Manager,phone 352-2554, after hours 564-1424
Risk Management Plan- Executive Summary: Richland Location.

1.Facility Policy:
The management, and employees of Schuyler Cooperative Assoc. are commited to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the company is prepared to coordinate with the local fire department and other local officials, to mitigate and minimize the impact of the release to people and the enviroment.

2. Facility Information:
The primary operation at this facility is the storage of anhydrous ammonia for blending fertilizer.

Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application and for blending into mixed-grade fertilizers for crop production nutrients.

The maximum quantity stored at this location would be 600,000lbs. In three rail cars, which hold 39,000 gallons each.

3. The accidental release prevention program: 
Our Schuyler facility has implanted the proviisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc.,and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration, 29 CFR 1910.11, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous ammonia".
4.. The Five Year Accident History:
A. There has been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that:

:has caused death, injury, or property damage at our facility.
:Or to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries,evacuations, property damage or enviromental change.

5. Emergency Response Program:
Our Facility has:
A. A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.
B. Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right to know information,as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA)>
C. Our facility employees recognize and are able to contain a spill, and notify the right p

eople to clean up a spill in accordance with level 1 and level 2 of OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.120, including pre-emergency planning and employee training.

6. Planned changes to improve safety:
